The domain ''mediafire.com'' attracted at least 8.7 million visitors annually by 2008 according to a [[Compete.com]] study.<ref>[http://siteanalytics.compete.com/mediafire.com?metric=uv Mediafire attracts almost 9m visitors online yearly]</ref>
The domain ''mediafire.com'' attracted at least 8.7 million visitors annually by 2008 according to a [[Compete.com]] study.<ref>[http://siteanalytics.compete.com/mediafire.com?metric=uv Mediafire attracts almost 9m visitors online yearly]</ref>
  +
Currently (as of May, 2008) it has an [[Alexa internet|Alexa ranking]] of 100 [http://www.alexa.com/data/details/traffic_details/mediafire.com]
== Usage ==
== Usage ==
The service is available for free and allows users to [[upload]] files of up to 100 [[Megabyte|MB]]. The user is then supplied with a unique [[URL]], which locates the file and enables anyone with whom the uploader shares it to [[download]] the file. Currently there is no time limit on how long uploaded files will be stored.<ref>[http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=2&nav=0 Mediafire FAQ]</ref> Furthermore, images can be uploaded and displayed in galleries.

The user is then supplied with a unique [[URL]], which locates the file and enables anyone with whom the uploader shares it to [[download]] the file. Currently there is no time limit on how long uploaded files will be stored.<ref>[http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=2&nav=0 Mediafire FAQ]</ref> Furthermore, images can be uploaded and displayed in galleries.
